    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the Firm with a number of initial Employees defined in Properties: INIT_EMPLOYEES.

      • actionFlow

        public void actionFlow()
        Defines the sequence of actions that a Firm ought to follow so that the Economy flows consistently.
        Sequence:
        1. Update historical variables
        2. Clear previous goods from the Market
        3. Estimate the Target Production (TP)
        4. Calculate needed resources to accomplish TP (capital goods and labor)
        5. Buy/Sell Capital Goods
        6. Hire/Fire Labor
        7. Pay Labor
        8. Update goods prices
        9. Put goods to sale

      • assessTargetProduction

        private void assessTargetProduction()
                             throws utilities.TargetProductionException
        Defines an estimated value for the targetProduction based on the firm's sales.
        Throws:
        utilities.TargetProductionException

      • planResources

        private long[] planResources()
                      throws utilities.TargetProductionException
        Calculates needed resources to accomplish the Target Production estimated by assessTargetProduction().

        Uses two algorithms to calculate resources increase or reduction, respectively: calcOptimalResources() and calcResourcesReduction().
        Returns:
        an array [resources] with 3 positions (0-needed labor, 1-needed capital, 2-cost margin) OR null if the firm has reached bankruptcy
        Throws:
        utilities.TargetProductionException

      • manageCapital

        private void manageCapital(long neededCapital)
                    throws utilities.InsufficientFundsException
        Buys capital based on the neededCapital.
        Parameters:
        neededCapital - value which resulted from planResources() ( resources[1]).
        Throws:
        utilities.InsufficientFundsException

      • manageLabor

        private void manageLabor(long neededLabor)
                  throws utilities.InsufficientFundsException
        Hires or fires employees based on the neededLabor.
        Also pays the employees (so that they have funds to buy goods the moment a Firm puts them to sale).
        Parameters:
        neededLabor - value which resulted from planResources() ( resources[0]).
        Throws:
        utilities.InsufficientFundsException

      • assessGoodsPrice

        private void assessGoodsPrice()
                       throws utilities.UnprofitablePriceSettingException
        Increases or reduces the goodsPrice based on the amount of sold goods.
        Throws:
        utilities.UnprofitablePriceSettingException

      • manageGoods

        private void manageGoods()
                  throws utilities.FirmStockCountException
        Puts as many goods in the GoodsMarket as those defined by the targetProduction.
        Throws:
        utilities.FirmStockCountException
